metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2056 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
xymond in Xymon 4.1.x, 4.2.x, and 4.3.x before 4.3.25 allow remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in the adduser_name argument in (1) web/useradm.c or (2) web/chpasswd.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xymon - 4.3.25-1
xymon-client - 4.3.25-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xymon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.25-1').
